subject: Re: [junit] Testing for Objects returned in random order
msgSnippet: You are right. I just want to make it general by statements ;-) Regards, Hai ... A nice to express it. For me, the Evident Data is a stream of numbers, which
messageBody:
You are right. I just want to make it general by statements ;-)

Regards,
Hai

"J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...> wrote: Nguyen Phuc Hai wrote:

> Two rules of unit testing is 'Test your code not library code' and
> 'Evident data'. For method that the values are not defined until running
> as random, or takes time like schedule (should we write a test for
> method is scheduled to run within 1 hours). Applying above two rules, we
> can abstract the library code and use Mock object to have 'Evident
> data', we focus to test our business code not what library assume to do
> (we think random, schedule do the good job already - some cases, library
> does not do like expected but detecting it is another story).

A nice to express it. For me, the Evident Data is a stream of numbers,
which is why I'd rather depend on interface NumberStream, implemented by
RandomNumberStream instead of interface RandomNumberGenerator with a
"fake RandomNumberGenerator". The difference is subtle, but I think the
design describes itself better.
--
